altText: Corporate video production studio with professional camera equipment
title: StudioTech Belgium Celebrates 35 Years of Innovation in Broadcast & Media
description:
From its founding in Brussels to becoming a leading European broadcast systems integrator, StudioTech Belgium marks 35 years of excellence in broadcast integration, systems design, and audiovisual solutions.

A Journey of Excellence

Since our establishment in 1989, StudioTech Belgium has evolved into a comprehensive solutions provider, serving broadcasters, media companies, and corporate clients across Europe and beyond. Our commitment to innovation, quality, and customer satisfaction has been the cornerstone of our success over these 35 years.

Key Milestones

1989

Foundation

StudioTech Belgium was founded in Brussels as a broadcast systems integrator

1995

Major Growth

Expansion of services and first major international projects

2005

Innovation Leader

Leading position in broadcast systems integration across Europe

2024

35 Years of Excellence

Celebrating 35 years as a trusted partner in broadcast innovation

"For 35 years, StudioTech Belgium has been at the forefront of broadcast innovation. Our journey has been marked by continuous adaptation to new technologies while maintaining our commitment to excellence and customer satisfaction."

- StudioTech Belgium Leadership Team

Looking to the Future

As we celebrate this milestone, we remain committed to pushing boundaries and delivering cutting-edge solutions. Our focus on innovation, sustainability, and client success continues to drive our vision for the next 35 years.

35
Years of Excellence
1500+
Projects Delivered
30+
Countries Served

altText: Modern conference room with video conferencing technology
title: IBC 2024
description:
Let's Shape the Future of Audiovisual Technology Together!

We are excited to invite you to join Studiotech Belgium at IBC 2024, happening from 13 to 16 September in Amsterdam. Visit us at stand 2.A51 in Hall 2 to explore the latest trends, innovative solutions, and strengthen our partnership. In today's fast-evolving media landscape, staying ahead is essential.

Secure your spot for a personalized demonstration at Stand 10.A25

Event Details

Dates: 13-16 September 2024
Location: RAI Amsterdam
Stand: 10.A25

title: ​DPGMedia VTM-Kids Onair with Evertz Mediator-X
description:
In a major technological advancement, DPG Media successfully launched its first channel using the next-generation Evertz Mediator-X system, marking a significant milestone in their broadcasting capabilities.

January 2017

Legacy System Implementation

DPG Media (formerly Medialaan) begins broadcasting all 6 channels 24/7 using Evertz Mediator-8

November 2020

Contract Signing

DPG signs contract with Studiotech to build new IP-2110 Playout Automation and Enterprise Grade MAM system

Jan-April 2021

Equipment Delivery & Implementation

Equipment delivery and installation phase, with close collaboration between DPG Teams and Evertz UK Project team

April 2022

System Testing

Successfully passed SAT & UAT testing phases

May 2022

Launch

First channel successfully launched using new Mediator-X system

Technical Implementation

Core Infrastructure

Virtualized DELL VXRAIL Core & Compute cluster architecture with Isilon Central Storage and Evertz Overture ORT Playout engines

SDVN 2110 Components

  • Evertz 3080IPX-128 Redundant Switching Fabrics
  • Evertz 570IPG Gateways
  • evMV-25G IP multi-viewers
  • Evertz EV6-FR frames with Scorpion Edge devices

Control Systems

  • Evertz Magnum
  • Vistalink
  • Insite
  • VUE intelligent Control interfaces

altText: March 2021 • ChadStudiotech Belgium responsible for digitisation
title: Studiotech Belgium responsible for digitisation
description:
StudioTech successfully delivered a massive production solution for Chad National Television. Multiple production facilities were equipped with the latest broadcast technology.

The Project

The project includes:

  • A complete production control room
  • A news studio
  • A secondary production facility
  • A master control room
  • All necessary production and playout automation systems
'This project represents a major step forward in modernizing Chad's national broadcasting capabilities. The new infrastructure enables more efficient operations and higher production quality.'

- Project Director, StudioTech

Technical Details

The comprehensive solution features:

  • State-of-the-art production switchers and vision mixers
  • Advanced graphics systems
  • Complete multi-camera studio setup
  • Automated playout solutions
  • Digital asset management and archiving systems

Key Project Highlights

Modern Infrastructure

Latest broadcast technology integrated across multiple facilities

Production Efficiency

Streamlined workflows and automated systems

Future-Ready

Scalable solution ready for future expansion

Ready to Transform Your Broadcast Operations?

Learn how StudioTech can help modernize your production facilities with cutting-edge solutions.

altText: Cameroon Radio Television (CRTV) CHAN and CAN: Studiotech Belgium AV supplier for CRTV (Cameroon Radio Television)
title: Cameroon Radio Television (CRTV) CHAN and CAN: Studiotech Belgium AV supplier for CRTV (Cameroon Radio Television)
description:
Championship Coverage

The African Nations Championship (CHAN), organized by the Confederation of African Football (CAF), took place in January and February 2021 after being postponed from 2020 due to the pandemic. The tournament concluded with Morocco's impressive 2-0 victory over Mali in the Yaoundé final, successfully defending their title.

'This project represents a significant milestone in broadcasting capabilities for African football, combining cutting-edge technology with local expertise.'

- Technical Director, CRTV

Technical Implementation

For this prestigious event, AVSolutions provided CRTV (Cameroon Radio Television) with state-of-the-art broadcasting equipment including:

  • 20+2 camera production system in flight cases
  • Mercedes Actros 3340 cab with 88m³ trailer
  • 88 kVA generator system
  • 45 kVA UPS inverter

February 2021 • Control Room Installation at Douala Stadium

February 2021 • Studiotech staff at the Reunification Stadium in Douala

Cameroon Logistics vehicle for production management 20+2 HD flight-case cameras

Training and Collaboration

Beyond equipment provision, AVSolutions worked closely with CRTV engineers to provide comprehensive training for Cameroonian operators. This collaboration ensured excellent coverage of both opening and closing ceremonies, setting new standards for broadcasting quality in the region.

Future Impact

The infrastructure implemented in Yaoundé will continue to serve future events, including the upcoming Africa Cup of Nations (CAN). This tournament will utilize seven ultra-modern stadiums across Cameroon, all benefiting from the advanced broadcasting capabilities now in place.

Ready to Elevate Your Broadcasting Capabilities?

Learn how AVSolutions can transform your media infrastructure with cutting-edge technology and expert implementation.

Contact Us Today

altText: May 2020 Studiotech Belgium supplies a 10 camera HD production truck for the Republic of Niger
title: May 2020 Studiotech Belgium supplies a 10 camera HD production truck for the Republic of Niger
description:
Many months of study were necessary to design this flagship vehicle put together in the Studiotech Belgium workshops.

Advanced Camera Technology

Our HD8 production cameras represent the pinnacle of broadcast technology, featuring:

  • Native 4K/UHD resolution
  • High dynamic range (HDR) capability
  • Advanced image stabilization
  • Super slow-motion recording
  • Remote operation capabilities

Resolution

4K/UHD (3840x2160)

Frame Rate

Up to 120fps at 4K

Dynamic Range

15+ stops

Output

12G-SDI / HDMI 2.0

Integration & Control

The HD8 camera system seamlessly integrates with existing broadcast infrastructure and supports:

  • Industry-standard control protocols
  • Remote camera control units (CCU)
  • Automated camera movements
  • Multi-camera synchronization
'The HD8 camera system represents a quantum leap in broadcast technology, delivering unprecedented image quality and operational flexibility for live production environments.'

Ready to Upgrade Your Production Capabilities?

Contact us to learn more about our HD8 camera systems and professional integration services.

altText: Studiotech Belgium puts its know-how at the service of the Republic of Senegal
title: Studiotech Belgium puts its know-how at the service of the Republic of Senegal
description:
< class='article-content'>

The Belgian systems integrator is actively participating in the technological renewal of the Senegalese Radio/Television Broadcasting infrastructure in Dakar.

RTS3 et RTS4

This technological challenge covers the complete modernisation of two control rooms and two complete studios with new lighting for RTS1 Dakar as well as the renewal of equipment for two studios and a shared control room for RTS2.

Senegalese Television now has a new Master Control Room and Nodal comprising the Evertz EQX-10 hybrid video central matrix, new Evertz 3067VIPX multiviewers, intercom & KVM matrices, audio processors, Autocue prompting infrastructure, four 55'' video walls including one comprising 12 screens.

Notably Studiotech secured the power supply by UPS multiples of 30 and 60 KVA.

Studiotech Belgium has deployed a new Avid iNews and Graphics system for the production of news with integration of the PAM Interplay infrastructure and existing archiving.

This migration was carried out in record time by a joint task force of Studiotech and Avid personnel.

The infrastructure implemented is fully digital HD and AES. RTS1 Television and Radio are now centralised in a single Nodal enabling interconnection between the two institutions. The project is fully computerised, all equipment being configurable from administrator PCs to allow the optimum operating flexibility.

RTS1 Control Room and Studio 4 News

RTS1 • Studio 1 Control Room

RTS1 and RTS2 Modernization

Studiotech has also renovated two regional television channels in eastern and southern Senegal: RTS3 Tambacounda and RTS4 Ziguinchor respectively.

In each of the two channels, Studiotech has deployed a Studio 4 camera production system as well as Media Composer stations and dedicated broadcast servers.

RTS3 • Tambacounda

RTS National Radio and RSI Radio now also benefit from two control rooms each: production and broadcasting. New Winmedia broadcast/recording software, AEQ digital audio mixers, broadcast and recording servers, audio processors for the antenna, Tally system at control room and hall level and central AES audio matrix at Nodal level.

Ten mobile production units with hybrid systems and audio codec also enrich Radio. Broadcasting agencies now have an automated multicam system for web radio and filmed radio. Presence of a CDM modulation centre for control, verification and switching on antenna as well as audio intercommunication between the various control rooms.

Radio Control Room

CDM modulation centre

Studiotech also supplied RTS with an energy vehicle and a DSNG on an Iveco chassis equipped with 4 Sony HDC-300 cameras including one HF/wire, a 2m40 C band satellite antenna, HPA 400W x 2, a generator, an Evertz Xenon 32 * 32 matrix, a Sony MVS-3000 32/16 video mixer, an Evertz 3067VIPX multiviewer and a Clear-Com Pico 32 intercom.

Integration & Control

The HD8 camera system seamlessly integrates with existing broadcast infrastructure and supports:

  • Industry-standard control protocols
  • Remote camera control units (CCU)
  • Automated camera movements
  • Multi-camera synchronization
'The HD8 camera system represents a quantum leap in broadcast technology, delivering unprecedented image quality and operational flexibility for live production environments.'

Ready to Upgrade Your Production Capabilities?

Contact us to learn more about our HD8 camera systems and professional integration services.

Get in Touch

altText: STUDIOTECH BELGIUM AV SUPPLIER FOR CHAN 2021 AND CAN 2022
title: STUDIOTECH BELGIUM AV SUPPLIER FOR CHAN 2021 AND CAN 2022
description:
Renowned for its contribution to coverage of the Francophone Games and Summits in Africa and its VAR solution for the Belgian Jupiler Pro League, Studiotech Belgium has become the AV supplier for CHAN 2020 (African Nations Championship) and CAN 2021 (Africa Cup of Nations), two sporting events awakening growing interest all around the world.

')">

CHAN 2021 was held in Cameroon from 16 January to 7 February 2021. CAN 2022 will be held from 15 January to 28 February in Yaoundé, Douala, Limbé, Bafoussam and Garoua. The 2019 title holder is Algeria.To this end, Studiotech Belgium has supplied CRTV (Cameroon Radio Television) with a cab/trailer production system of 20 + 2 cameras in flight cases and the trailer is an accompanying vehicle.The unit comprises a Mercedes Actros 3340 cab and an 88 m³ trailer with an 88 kVA generator and a 45 kVA UPS inverter.Studiotech Belgium has relied on its privileged partner Evertz Microsystems to provide DreamCatcher slow-motion systems, servers and routers, video and audio grids, sync generators, distribution and conversion.

altText: MARCH 2019 • MOROCCO: 12th GENERAL ASSEMBLY OF THE AFRICAN UNION OF BROADCASTING (AUB) AT WHICH STUDIOTECH BELGIUM WAS AN EXHIBITOR
title: MARCH 2019 • MOROCCO: 12th GENERAL ASSEMBLY OF THE AFRICAN UNION OF BROADCASTING (AUB) AT WHICH STUDIOTECH BELGIUM WAS AN EXHIBITOR
description:
This international event was held from 25 to 29 March 2019 at the impressive Palais des Congrès in Marrakech.

This year's theme was the influence of new media on the African audiovisual industry. The event attracted more than 150 AUB members, including 50 exhibitors and more than 2000 visitors.Studiotech Belgium participated in this event and it facilitated a unique opportunity to meet face-to-face with CEOs, Technical Directors and broadcasters from the whole African continent to discuss, amongst other key topics, the ever-increasing migration from analogue to digital.
